title: Partners Group Sees Clean-Energy Tailwind in Infrastructure Bill
sub_head: The $1 trillion spending measure would bolster investment areas including community solar and carbon capture
body:
Partners Group Holding AG, which in June had $119 billion in assets under management, has turned the world’s shift to low-carbon energy into one of its main investment areas. For instance, the Swiss private-equity firm in June agreed to back Dimension Energy LLC, an Atlanta-based developer of community solar projects that operates as Dimension Renewable Energy. Partners Group is also considering deals in the carbon-sequestration sector, said Todd Bright, the firm’s head of private infrastructure for the Americas.
